intro: Scorzonera ketzkhowelii, commonly known as the Ketzkhowel scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, leafy stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand cold and low-nutrient soils. Its root system is robust, allowing it to anchor firmly in unstable terrain. Scorzonera ketzkhowelii is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
